description:
Job description
SUMMARY OF POSITION
The RN is responsible for providing direct patient care in the context of a comprehensive reproductive health visit, in accordance with Morgentaler Clinic's standards and guidelines, in an efficient, sensitive, professional manner.
Flexibility is required as clinic operations vary daily.
ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS
Essential Job functions include but is not limited to:
Counselling

 Charting patient information, administering IV, drawing blood, recording vitals
 Prepares patients for the health care visit
 Verifies patient information by interviewing patient; reviewing and/or recording medical history
 Taking vital signs, blood pressure, hemoglobin levels, etc.
 Confirming purpose of visit or treatment, and reviews medications and allergies
 Completes records by recording patient examination, treatment, and test results
 Answer questions and obtain written consents
 Starting IV locks, drawing blood, and on-site testing of hemoglobin levels

Operating room

 Supports patient care delivery by assisting health care providers during examinations and procedures
 Setup, clean, sanitize and prepare the OR for patients
 Starting intravenous locks and venipuncture (would be an asset)
 Administering IV and operating room medication
 Dispensing and administering IV, drugs, medications and controlled substances as directed by a physician
 Performs limited pelvic ultrasounds for surgical patients, medical patients, patient’s undecided about surgery, and follow-up ultrasounds
 Provides intra-operative ultrasound guidance to ensure the image allows determination of procedure completeness makes adjustments to equipment as required
 Completes written documentation for use in medical treatment
 Inventories and orders supplies for the OR and recovery area
 Inventories ultrasound room and recovery area supplies and orders as necessary
 Keeps ultrasound and emergency equipment in good order by following operating instructions and notifies Health Center Manager if repairs or maintenance is needed

Recovery room management

 Monitoring patient’s post-surgery
 Answering patient’s questions
 Administering IV fluids, monitoring vital signs, administering medication
 Charting and maintaining patient data in EMR
 Remind patients to contact the clinic for any questions, need to attend the ER and follow up plans with family physicians
 Patient discharge ensuring and documenting discharge criteria (Aldrete)
 Performs follow up duties on laboratory and ultrasound results via email, text and phone conversations

Reprocessing

 Clean and sterilize instruments
 Maintain sterilization log and processes
 Follows and adheres to reprocessing standards
 Provide assistance to the OR nurse
 Completion of IPAC reprocessing certification (supported by the clinic)

OTHER GENERAL JOB DUTIES
General job duties will include:

 Maintains patient data in EMR/EHR and adheres to documentation standards to support efficient claims processing
 Adheres to clinic goals and policies regarding professionalism, minimizing patient wait time in the clinic and on the phone
 Adheres to a system for addressing patient complaints, and implementing patient satisfaction surveys following each visit
 Maintains confidentiality of all patient information, patient nonpublic personal information, and personal health information, as well as records directly or indirectly identifying any person currently or formerly receiving services from the clinic
 Complies with clinic confidentiality policies and procedures

QUALIFICATIONS & EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS

 Current valid RN license in Ontario
 Ability to work flexible hours
 ACLS certification preferred
 OB/GYN or family planning experience preferred
 Bilingual preferred

ADDITIONAL SKILLS

 Skill in Ultra sound
 Ability to relate to diverse communities
 Accuracy and attention to detail
 Work independently and as a team member
 Possess a warm, caring manner
 Ability to physically assist a patient in distress
 Ability to work under pressure
 Computer skills desirable
 Professional appearance and attitude
 Availability to work flexible hours, as required
 Strong commitment to the goals, quality healthcare and excellent customer service
 Family planning experience desirable

Job Types: Permanent, Part-timePart-time hours: 22.5 per week
Salary: $33.00-$35.00 per hour
Expected hours: 15 – 22 per week
Benefits:

 Dental care
 Employee assistance program
 Extended health care
 Life insurance
 Paid time off

Schedule:

 8 hour shift
 Day shift
 Monday to Friday
 No weekends

Supplemental pay types:

 Bonus pay

Ability to commute/relocate:

 Ottawa, ON K1P 5N2: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Education:

 Bachelor's Degree (preferred)

Experience:

 Nursing: 3 years (preferred)

Language:

 French (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

 Registered Nurse (RN) License (preferred)

Work Location: In person
Application deadline: 2023-10-23Expected start date: 2023-10-30
